definition: last day of a lunar month/dark/night

sentences.english: The research that leads to a Nobel Prize in physics can sometimes be a little obscure.
sentences.chinese: 获得诺贝尔奖的研究有时候是有些模糊晦涩的。

sentences.english: This dark assertion will be illuminatd later on.
sentences.chinese: 这句晦涩的话，下文将有说明。

sentences.english: Big words can make the way dark for those who hear what you say and read what you write.
sentences.chinese: 大词会使听你说话和读你文章的人感到晦涩难懂。

sentences.english: Deliberately obfuscated source code is not allowed.
sentences.chinese: 故意地使源代码变得含混晦涩是不允许的。
这段话比较晦涩，但是很明智。

sentences.english: Clauses often obscure and expatiatory, be read not easily and understand.
sentences.chinese: 保险条款往往晦涩冗长，不易阅读和理解。

sentences.english: The wording is so ambiguous that it leads to misinterpretations.
sentences.chinese: 措辞晦涩，致使人误解本意。

sentences.english: Translating an obscure piece of writing is even more painstaking than writing it directly.
sentences.chinese: 翻译一篇晦涩的作品要比直接写一篇更费苦心。

sentences.english: They seem interested in obscure knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 看起来只对晦涩的学识感兴趣。

sentences.english: Yet Zhu's political message. if indeed it exists, is an elusive one.
sentences.chinese: 然而朱伟的社会信息，如果有的话，却是晦涩难懂的。

sentences.english: Yet I cannot agree with the writers who call him obscure.
sentences.chinese: 然而我不能同意作家们说他晦涩。

sentences.english: Readers of poetry will know that modern poets like to use big and esoteric words.
sentences.chinese: 读过诗的都知道，现代诗歌惯用大量晦涩的词汇。

sentences.english: But not accessible to most people.
sentences.chinese: 但是对大众来说晦涩难懂。

sentences.english: But the code is still rather obfuscated.
sentences.chinese: 但是这个代码实在是太晦涩了。

definition: abstruse/profound mystery/the mysteries of the universe
to not know what sb is driving at/to be unintelligible
apparently right but actually wrong; specious (idiom)
